p: To estimate α-TA occurrence in T. pulegioides, there were investigated 131 different habitats of this species in Lithuania ( Figure 2, Table S1). The aerial parts of T. pulegioides have been separately collected from each habitat in July (during the full flowering stage) in the following way: same selected mass of aerial part of T. pulegioides was cut from each individual plant growing in the habitat and mixed. The weight was selected depending on each habitat abundance and/or size of individual plants in the habitat: 10 g of aerial part from each individual plant of T. pulegioides was cut in abundant/big habitats, but only 30–50 g was cut in small habitats. The aerial parts of plants were dried at room temperature over 4–5 days.
